mas_base_frr_mas_01.name: Cloud Service Offering Identification
mas_base_frr_mas_01.description: FedRAMP MAS > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
mas_base_frr_mas_01.instructions: Providers MUST identify a set of _information resources_ to assess for FedRAMP authorization that includes all _information resources_ that are _likely_ to _handle_ _federal customer data_ or _likely_ to impact the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of _federal customer data_ _handled_ by the _cloud service offering_.

mas_base_frr_mas_02.name: Third-Party Information Resources
mas_base_frr_mas_02.description: FedRAMP MAS > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
mas_base_frr_mas_02.instructions: Providers MUST include the configuration and usage of _third-party information resources_, ONLY IF _FRR-MAS-01_ APPLIES.

mas_base_frr_mas_03.name: Non-FedRAMP Authorized Third-Party Information Resources
mas_base_frr_mas_03.description: FedRAMP MAS > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
mas_base_frr_mas_03.instructions: Providers MUST clearly identify and document the justification, mitigation measures, compensating controls, and potential impact to _federal customer data_ from the configuration and usage of non-FedRAMP authorized _third-party information resources_, ONLY IF _FRR-MAS-01_ APPLIES.

mas_base_frr_mas_04.name: Metadata Inclusion
mas_base_frr_mas_04.description: FedRAMP MAS > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
mas_base_frr_mas_04.instructions: Providers MUST include metadata (including metadata about _federal customer data_), ONLY IF _FRR-MAS-01_ APPLIES.

mas_base_frr_mas_05.name: Information Flows and Impact Levels
mas_base_frr_mas_05.description: FedRAMP MAS > Base. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
mas_base_frr_mas_05.instructions: Providers MUST clearly identify, document, and explain information flows and impact levels for ALL _information resources_, ONLY IF _FRR-MAS-01_ APPLIES.

mas_application_frr_mas_ay_01.name: Scope of FedRAMP
mas_application_frr_mas_ay_01.description: FedRAMP MAS > Application. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
mas_application_frr_mas_ay_01.instructions: Certain categories of cloud computing products and services are specified as entirely outside the scope of FedRAMP by the Director of the Office of Management and Budget. All such products and services are therefore not included in the _cloud service offering_ for FedRAMP. For more, see https://fedramp.gov/scope.

mas_application_frr_mas_ay_02.name: Non-Cloud-Based Software
mas_application_frr_mas_ay_02.description: FedRAMP MAS > Application. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
mas_application_frr_mas_ay_02.instructions: Software produced by cloud service providers that is delivered separately for installation on agency systems and not operated in a shared responsibility model (typically including agents, application clients, mobile applications, etc. that are not fully managed by the cloud service provider) is not a cloud computing product or service and is entirely outside the scope of FedRAMP under the FedRAMP Authorization Act. All such software is therefore not included in the _cloud service offering_ for FedRAMP. For more, see fedramp.gov/scope.

mas_application_frr_mas_ay_03.name: Exclusion of Non-Impacting Information Resources
mas_application_frr_mas_ay_03.description: FedRAMP MAS > Application. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
mas_application_frr_mas_ay_03.instructions: _Information resources_ (including _third-party information resources_) that do not meet the conditions in FRR-MAS-01 are not included in the _cloud service offering_ for FedRAMP (_FRR-MAS-02_).

mas_application_frr_mas_ay_04.name: Impact Level Variations
mas_application_frr_mas_ay_04.description: FedRAMP MAS > Application. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
mas_application_frr_mas_ay_04.instructions: _Information resources_ (including _third-party information resources_) MAY vary by impact level as appropriate to the level of information _handled_ or impacted by the information resource (_FRR-MAS-05_).

mas_application_frr_mas_ay_05.name: Review of Best Practices
mas_application_frr_mas_ay_05.description: FedRAMP MAS > Application. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
mas_application_frr_mas_ay_05.instructions: All parties SHOULD review best practices and technical assistance provided separately by FedRAMP for help with applying the Minimum Assessment Scope as needed.

mas_application_frr_mas_ay_06.name: Cloud Service Offering Determination
mas_application_frr_mas_ay_06.description: FedRAMP MAS > Application. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
mas_application_frr_mas_ay_06.instructions: All aspects of the _cloud service offering_ are determined and maintained by the cloud service provider in accordance with related FedRAMP authorization requirements and documented by the cloud service provider in their assessment and authorization materials.

mas_exceptions_frr_mas_ex_01.name: Supplemental Information
mas_exceptions_frr_mas_ex_01.description: FedRAMP MAS > Exceptions. Impact Levels: Low, Moderate, High
mas_exceptions_frr_mas_ex_01.instructions: Providers MAY include documentation of _information resources_ beyond the _cloud service offering_, or even entirely outside the scope of FedRAMP, in a FedRAMP assessment and _authorization package_ supplement; these resources will not be FedRAMP authorized and MUST be clearly marked and separated from the _cloud service offering_.
